Astroblast is ok, rAuq, but please don't send posts as email 
attachments next time (you might not have sent it as an email 
attachment, but eGroups could have mistaken it for one or something).

::Killfest::

Killfest nods, opening his mouth to answer Astroblast's questions as 
the bot asks them, but interrupted every time by a new question. He 
finally closes his mouth, waiting for Astroblast to talk himself out. 
When the bot finishes, Killfest replies.

"Base locations, numbers, and other recorded info can be found back 
at base," he says, stretching out a hand, palm up. "I can, however, 
give you a slight overview of the locations, and the numbers of 
Predacon troops."

His palm lights up in several locations, a hologram of Earth apearing 
below it. "This is prehistoric earth, as you had said. There are 
roughly half a dozen major factions existing on the planet, some 
stronger than others."

The hologram of earth spins, showing a volcano in Greece. "First of 
all, this is the base of my faction of the Predacons. Three groups, 
led by me, DrillBit, and Darkfate, are allied and reside in this 
base. The other faction of Predacons is led by Megatron, and their 
base is located in the arctics." The hologram spins again, showing 
the location of Megatron's base.

"The two factions closest to being Predacon are the Destrons and the 
Alliance." Killfest was now reciting what he had read from the 
computer at the Council base before it was destroyed, and he hoped 
the information was accurate. "The Destron base is located roughly on 
the other side of the planet from us, on a different continuent." His 
hologram once again spins, showing what would one day be called Mt. 
Katahdin, located in northern Maine. "The Alliance base is located 
quite a bit closer, on the same continuent as us." Now the hologram 
spins to show an island three miles off of the south coast of 
Spain. "Last, and quite possibly least, are the Maximals. Their base 
is located in the continent south of us, on the western part of that 
continuent." The hologram spins to show the deserts of Africa, 
highliting a spot on the west side of it. Killfest turns the hologram 
off. "To the best of my knowledge, the other factions don't have a 
fixed base, but they're there. For the numbers, we'd have to return 
to base."

He pauses, waiting for questions from Astroblast.
